short_summary: All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted at the latest by 2 PM EST on 28 November 2022.
full_summary:
# TENDER DOCUMENT

## Contract Title
F3059-22CL11 - Inspection, Repair, and Certification of Immersion Suits

## Reference Number
WS3713926273-Doc3714159827

## Solicitation Number
WS3713926273

## Publication Date
October 28, 2022

## Tender Closing Date
November 28, 2022, 2:00 PM EST

## Amendment Number
None

## Expected Contract Start and End Dates
The contract is expected to begin on November 28, 2022, and end on December 1, 2026.

## Tender Status
Expired

## Relevant Contracting Entity Information
### Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
#### Address
11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5, Canada

## Notice URL
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14494710?extsite=MTQ0OTQ3MTBfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

## Description of the Tender
On behalf of the Canadian Coast Guard, the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking a Standing Offer (SO) for the inspection, repair, and certification services of immersion suits and flight suits used on board Coast Guard vessels in Ontario and Quebec. All necessary supporting documentation and bids must be submitted by November 28, 2022, at the latest.

## Relevant Trade Agreements
This tender is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

## Evaluation Methodology
Bids will be evaluated based on the lowest price. All bids submitted after the specified closing time will be considered non-responsive.
